title: Little change for cho (not a buff or nerf)
body: his q slow should start start when the target hits the ground cause it is no sense that someone is slowed while knock upped  so in my opinion reduce the slow duration of the same amount of the reimanent duration when the target hits the ground

I'd say it's balanced, as his abilities are harder to land than most other champions. Plus, they're high, but they aren't ridiculously high. Don't you think The Terror Of The Void should inflict more terror than all of the other void champions?
You don't think that, uh, the aoe 2.5 second silence (comparable to Malzahar but much easier to land) and the targeted AP-scaling true damage nuke is a bit oppressive?
That ult he has to walk up to you with his lack of speed buff or gapcloser, yeah.

> [{quoted}](name=Velrex,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ZsTAaRJo,comment-id=00000001000100050001,timestamp=2015-06-03T14:42:55.541+0000)
>
> That ult he has to walk up to you with his lack of speed buff or gapcloser, yeah.

That's why all his abilities mesh together to make him one of the best bursters in the entire game. Hit them with your Q (100% AP Ratio), or if they have an escape or gap closer, W them (70% AP Ratio), get a few auto attacks in if you need to (25% AP Ratio, I believe) and then finish them off with your ult (70% AP Ratio and deals true damage instead of magic damage).
The silence can be changed to 1.1-1.5 seconds and I wouldn't really care, just don't touch the Ult.

Cho is in a good spot imo (ignoring the needed VU :P ) but I would say that once you get big it's annoyingly difficult to judge your ability ranges. At 6 stacks ability ranges feel shorter than what they are since Cho takes up so much space. It would be interesting (if a bit concerning power wise) if your ability ranges increased as you gain stacks if for nothing else than so that it's easier to judge cast ranges and all stacks.
Any chance of a sneaky visual update/ rework in the future? ;D

For the love of god make his W width smaller. There is no way to dodge it if you are melee vs melee (top lane). He literally can hit it even if he casts it behind him.

He does that because of the way it's coded. Even if you flash away during the cast time you will be hit and silenced. It's the same with other cone abilities with cast times (Morde E, Darius E, Cass R, Kass E, etc).
